source_sentence: 佛說樹提伽經
translation: Jyotiṣa-sūtra Spoken by the Buddha

source_sentence: 宋于闐國三藏求那跋陀羅譯
translation: Song Dynasty Translation of the Tripiṭaka of the Yugan country, translated by Guanabhadra

source_sentence: 佛言：昔有一大富長者名樹提伽，倉庫盈實金銀具足，奴婢成行無所乏少。
translation: The Buddha said: Once upon a time, there was a great wealthy man named Jyotiṣa, whose storehouses were full of real gold and silver, and his slaves and maidservants did not lack anything.

source_sentence: 有一白[疊*毛]手巾挂著池邊，遇天風起吹王殿前。
translation: There was a white [tufted*hair] hand cloth hanging from the edge of the pond, blown in front of the king's palace by a heavenly wind.

source_sentence: 王即大會群臣坐共參論，羅列卜問怪其所以，諸臣皆言：「國將欲大興，
translation: The king immediately sat down in the great assembly of ministers to discuss the matter, and when Rāhula asked why he was so surprised, all the ministers said, “The kingdom is about to prosper.

source_sentence: 天賜白[疊*毛]。」
translation: The gods gave white [tuft of *hair].

source_sentence: 唯樹提伽默然無言。
translation: Only Jyotiṣa remained silent and said nothing.

source_sentence: 王問樹提伽：「諸臣皆喜，卿何以無言？」
translation: The king asked Jyotiṣa, All the ministers are delighted, so why don't you say anything?

source_sentence: 提伽答言：「不敢欺王！
translation: Devadatta replied, I dare not deceive the king!

source_sentence: 是臣家拭體之巾，挂著池邊，遇天風起吹王殿前。
translation: The minister's householder wiped off his body with a towel, hung it at the edge of the pond, and encountered a heavenly wind blowing in front of the king's palace.

source_sentence: 以是之故，默然無言。」
translation: Because of this, he remained silent and said nothing.

source_sentence: 却後數日，有一九色金華大如車輪，遇天風起吹王殿前。
translation: Several days later a golden flower of nine colors, as large as a carriage wheel, rose up in the air and blew before the king’s palace.

source_sentence: 王即大會群臣坐共參論，羅列卜問怪其所以。
translation: The king then sat in the great assembly of ministers to discuss the matter together, and Luo Lingbao asked why he did so.

source_sentence: 諸臣皆言：「國將欲大興，天賜金華。」
translation: The ministers all said, The kingdom will want to prosper greatly, and the gods will give him a golden flower.

source_sentence: 臣樹提伽默然無言。
translation: The minister Jyotiṣa remained silent and said nothing.

source_sentence: 王問樹提伽：「諸臣皆喜，卿何以無言？」
translation: The king asked Jyotiṣa, All the ministers are delighted, so why don't you say anything?

source_sentence: 提伽答言：「不敢欺王！
translation: Devadatta replied, I dare not deceive the king!

source_sentence: 是臣家後園中萎落之華，遇天風起吹王殿前。
translation: The withered flowers in the garden behind the minister's house rose up in front of the king's palace when they encountered a heavenly wind.

source_sentence: 以是之故，默然無言。」
translation: Because of this, he remained silent and said nothing.

source_sentence: 王問提伽：「卿家乃爾。
translation: The king asked Devadatta, So is your family.

source_sentence: 速作調度，吾欲將領二十萬眾到卿家看望。」
translation: Quickly tame them, and I want to bring 20,000 people with me to your house to look out for you.

source_sentence: 樹提伽答言：「願王相隨至臣之家，臣有自然床席不須人布，自然飲食不須人作，
translation: Jyotiṣka replied, May the king go with them to his ministers' homes, and their ministers have a natural bed or seat that doesn't need human cloth, and they can eat and drink naturally without human effort.

source_sentence: 自然擎來不須喚呼，自然擎去不須反顧。」
translation: It's naturally raised without need to be called, and it's naturally raised without need to be looked back.

source_sentence: 王即將領二十萬眾，到樹提伽家遊看。
translation: The king then led 200,000 people to the house of Jyotiṣa and visited it.

source_sentence: 南門直入，門中有一童子，顏容端正，肉色瑤悅，甚復可愛。
translation: He entered directly through the southern gate. There was a youthful boy in the gate, with an elegant appearance and pleasing flesh like a yak; he was also very attractive.

source_sentence: 王問樹提伽：「是卿家兒孫耶？」
translation: The king asked Jyotiṣa, Is this your family's child or grandson?

source_sentence: 提伽答言：「不敢欺王！
translation: Devadatta replied, I dare not deceive the king!

source_sentence: 是臣家守門之奴。」
translation: He's a servant of the minister's family who guards the gate.

source_sentence: 小復前進到其中門，有一童女，顏容端正，肉色瑤悅，甚復可愛。
translation: Again, he proceeded a little further and came to the entrance. There was a young woman with an elegant countenance of bodily youthful appearance who was delighted; she looked very attractive.

source_sentence: 王問樹提伽：「是卿家婦女耶？」
translation: The king asked Jyotiṣa, Is this the woman of your house?

source_sentence: 提伽答言：「不敢欺王！
translation: Devadatta replied, I dare not deceive the king!

source_sentence: 是臣家守閤之婢。」
translation: This is the maidservant of the minister's household.

source_sentence: 小復前進到其戶內，白銀為壁，水精為地，王呼水流疑不得進，樹提伽即導王前而入，
translation: The king called out to the water and doubted that he could not enter. Jyotiṣa led the king in front of him and entered.

source_sentence: 黃金為床，白玉為机，樹提伽婦有百二十重金銀幃帳。
translation: The king’s wife Jyotiṣa had one hundred and twentyfold curtains of gold and silver.

source_sentence: 樹提伽婦端正無雙，為王作禮眼中淚出。
translation: The Jyotiṣa's wife was unsurpassed in beauty, and she paid homage to the king with tears coming out of her eyes.

source_sentence: 王問提伽：「卿婦見我，有何不㤿，眼中淚出？」
translation: The king asked Devadatta, When your wife saw me, why didn't she see me with tears coming out of her eyes?

source_sentence: 提伽答言：「不敢欺王！
translation: Devadatta replied, I dare not deceive the king!

source_sentence: 聞王煙氣，以是之故，眼中淚出。」
translation: I heard the king's breath of smoke, and because of this, tears came out of his eyes.

source_sentence: 王言：「庶人然脂，諸侯然蠟，天子然漆，亦無煙也，何得淚出？」
translation: The king said, If the common people say fat, the princes say wax, and the gods say lacquer, and there's no smoke, how can weep come out?

source_sentence: 提伽答言：「不敢欺王！
translation: Devadatta replied, I dare not deceive the king!

source_sentence: 是臣之家有一明月神珠挂著殿堂，晝夜無異，不須火光，王是煙中之王，
translation: In the house of this minister there is a bright moon-sacred pearl that hangs in the palace day and night without distinction. The king is the king among the smoke gods.

source_sentence: 是故聞氣耳。」
translation: That's why they hear the energy.

source_sentence: 樹提伽家堂前有十二重高樓，將王上頭，視東忘西，視南忘北，奄奄忽忽以經一月。
translation: In front of the house of Jyotiṣa there were twelve story high buildings, which faced the king’s head and looked east but forgot to see east; looking south but forgot to see north.

source_sentence: 大臣白言：「國計事大，事須還歸，斷理人民。」
translation: The ministers said, The state's business is big, and the business must be returned to it, cutting off the people in principle.

source_sentence: 王謂：「須臾，小復可忍。」
translation: The king said, In a moment, the small can be tolerated.

source_sentence: 樹提伽將王後園中遊看，流泉浴池中沐浴，食果自適，甘美無比，甚復可愛，
translation: Jyotiṣa, the king’s general, was enjoying leisurely excursions in the park behind him. He bathed in a bathing pond with streams and streams and enjoyed his fill of delicious fruit as he wished. It was incomparably sweet and very pleasing.

source_sentence: 以至一月。
translation: It's until the first month.

source_sentence: 大臣白王：「可須還國，國計事大，斷理人民。」
translation: The ministers said to the king, You must return to your country, for national affairs are so large that they cut off the principle and people.

source_sentence: 王謂：「吁！
translation: The king said, Xuan!

source_sentence: 須臾，小復可忍。」
translation: In a moment, the small can be tolerated again.

source_sentence: 樹提伽即布施金銀珍寶、綾羅繒綵，二十萬眾人馬車乘一時俱重還國。
translation: Jyotiṣa then offered gold, silver, precious treasures, silk, and silk fabric as gifts, and 200,000 people in horses and chariots returned to the kingdom one after another.

source_sentence: 王即會群臣坐共參論，羅列卜問怪其所以：「樹提伽是我之臣，婦女舍宅過甚於我。
translation: The king then assembled the ministers to sit and discussed together, and Rāṣṭrapāla asked why he wondered, saying, Jyotiṣka is my minister, and the woman's dwelling place is far greater than mine.

source_sentence: 我欲伐之，可取與不？」
translation: If I want to cut it down, can I give it to you?

source_sentence: 諸臣皆言：「宜可取之。」
translation: The ministers all said, It's advisable to take it.

source_sentence: 王即興四十萬眾，搥鐘鳴鼓，往圍樹提伽舍數百餘重。
translation: The king immediately summoned 40,000 people to the assembly, sounded the bells and played the drums, and surrounded the tree with several hundred sets of deghāsas.

source_sentence: 樹提伽家門中，有一力士，手捉金杖一擬，四十萬眾一時俱倒，手脚繚戾，
translation: At the entrance to the house of Jyotiṣa, there was a strong man holding a golden staff in his hand. The four hundred thousand monks all fell down at once, their hands and feet trembling violently.

source_sentence: 尻髖妸婆，狀似醉容，搖頭頗[我*頁]，臥地不起。
translation: His buttocks and feet looked like they were drunken. He shook his head in shame and lay down on the ground, not rising.

source_sentence: 樹提伽乘飛雲輪，車在虛空中問諸人等：「來時何意，臥地不起？」
translation: Jyotiṣa flew on the cloud-wheeled chariot, and his chariot flew up into the sky to ask the people, What do you think when you're lying down and don't get up?

source_sentence: 諸人答樹提伽言：「國王遣我來，欲伐長者。
translation: The people replied to Jyotiṣa, saying, The king sent me here because he wanted to attack the elder.

source_sentence: 長者門中有一力士，手捉金杖一擬我等，四十萬眾一時俱倒，臥地不能起。」
translation: In the doorway of the elder's house, there's a strong man holding a gold staff in his hand that prepares for us, and 40,000 people will all fall down at once while lying on the ground and can't get up.

source_sentence: 樹提伽問之曰：「欲得起不？」
translation: Jyotiṣa asked him, Do you want to get up?

source_sentence: 諸人皆言：「我欲得起。」
translation: The people all said, I want to get up.

source_sentence: 樹提伽放大神目一視，四十萬眾一時俱起，還其本國。
translation: Jyotiṣa magnified his divine eye with a single glance, and 40,000 people rose up at once to return to their native land.

source_sentence: 王即遣使者喚樹提伽，樹提伽與王同車，而共載之，往至佛所，問言：「世尊！
translation: The king then sent an envoy to summon Jyotiṣa. Jyotiṣa and the king rode in the same chariot, carrying it together. They went to the Buddha and asked him:

source_sentence: 樹提伽是我之臣，前身有何功德，婦女舍宅過甚於我？」
translation: Jyotiṣa is my minister, so what merit did he have in his previous life that the house of a woman far surpasses me?

source_sentence: 佛言：「樹提伽布施功德，現天上受樂。
translation: The Buddha said, Jyotiṣa's merit of generosity is manifested in heaven to receive happiness.

source_sentence: 昔五百商主將諸商人，齎持重寶經過險路，奔空山中，走逢一病道人，
translation: Formerly five hundred merchant leaders led their merchants, carrying precious treasures, on dangerous paths and running through the airy mountains, ran into an ill man of the Way.

source_sentence: 給其草屋厚敷床褥，給其水漿鎢錥米糧，給其燈燭，于時乞願天堂之報，
translation: He gave them a thick-roofed bed and bedding in a grass hut, water, wine, cooked rice, and provisions, as well as lamps and candles. At that time he begged for the reward of heavenly life.

source_sentence: 今得果報。」
translation: Now, they'll attain their fruition.

source_sentence: 佛言：「是時布施者，今樹提伽夫婦是也；
translation: The Buddha said: This was the present-day donor at that time. These were the present-day Jyotiṣa and his wife.

source_sentence: 于時病道人者，今我身是也；
translation: The person who was ill at that time and on the path of religion is now me.

source_sentence: 五百商主及商人者，皆得阿羅漢道。」
translation: The five hundred merchant lords and the merchants all attained the path of the arhat.

source_sentence: 佛說樹提伽經
translation: Jyotiṣa-sūtra Spoken by the Buddha
